card.name: KH Xemnas
card.text: Limit break 3 At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one — • Twilight Thorn — Xemnas has double strike and reach, and its power becomes 4 until your next upkeep. • Guard — Xemnas has vigilance, indestructible, and its power becomes 1 until your next upkeep. • Pierce — Xemnas deals 3 damage to any target and has flying until your next upkeep. • Begone — Xemnas has splash damage 2/2 until your next upkeep.

card.name: KH All-Vanity
card.text: During your next turn Xemnas has deathtouch and “When Xemnas attacks, create ten 1/1 colorless artifact creature tokens that are tapped and attacking. Exile the tokens at end of combat.”.

card.name: KH Xigbar
card.text: Double strike, limit break 2 Range (When this creature attacks it takes no damage from creatures without range or reach. This creature has reach.) {1}: Xigbar phases out.

card.name: KH Critical Snipe
card.text: During your next turn Xigbar has vigilance, triple strike and “After your first combat phase there is an additional combat phase.”

card.name: KH Xaldin
card.text: Limit break 2 {X}, {T}: Xaldin gains X + 1 jump counters. {T}: Xaldin phases out. Whenever Xaldin phases in remove all jump counters from it, then it deals that much damage to any target.

card.name: KH Dragoon Storm
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase, choose one — • Xaldin deals 4 damage to all the creatures you don’t control. • Put 5 jump counters on Xaldin.

card.name: KH Vexen
card.text: Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) 3U, {T}: Create a token that’s a copy of target creature, except the token isn’t legendary if target creature is legendary, and it’s a Nobody in addition to its other types.

card.name: KH Diamond Dust
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase you may pay 3U. If you do tap all creatures you don’t control. Otherwise tap up to 3 target creatures you don’t control. Creatures tapped this way can be targeted in combat until they become untapped.

card.name: KH Lexaeus
card.text: Last strike, trample Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) Whenever Lexaeus is dealt damage, it gains that much power.

card.name: KH Ayers Rock
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase Lexaeus deals damage to target creature equal to its power. Then tap Lexaeus.

card.name: KH Zexion
card.text: Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) {X}, {T}: Scry X + 1.

card.name: KH Meteor Mirage
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase Zexion deals 6 damage to up to 3 different target creatures, and 2 damage to all other creatures you don’t control.

card.name: KH Saïx
card.text: Limit break 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with 1 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) {C}: Deal 1 damage to Saïx. {X}, {T}: Remove X plus one limit break counters from Saïx.

card.name: KH Berserk
card.text: During your next turn Saïx has +5/+0, trample, and takes no combat damage.

card.name: KH Axel
card.text: Reach Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) Creatures your opponents control get -0/-1.

card.name: KH Explosion
card.text: During your next turn Axel gains splash damage 1 and. You may pay CR, if you do Axel gains splash damage 3 instead. (When this creature deals damage to a creature, deal 1 damage to other creatures that player controls.) Creatures your opponents control get -0/-1.

card.name: KH Demyx
card.text: Limit break 3 When Demyx enters the battlefield put two 1/1 blue Elemental creature tokens onto the battlefield. Demyx has indestructible as long as you control one or more blue Elemental creature tokens. 1U, {T}: Create a 1/1 blue Elemental creature token. During your upkeep, gain 1 life per each blue Elemental creature token you control.

card.name: KH Wave Gigs
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase create X+1 1/1 blue Elemental creature tokens, where X is the number of creatures opponent controls.

card.name: KH Luxord
card.text: Reach Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) When Luxord deals combat damage to a creature, that creature loses all its abilities and becomes a 1/1 artifact creature with: “{T}: Pay one life. Roll a D6. If the result is 5 or {6} exile this card then put it back to the battlefield tapped.”.

card.name: KH Jackpot
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase roll a D6, Luxord deals that much damage to any target. If the result is 6 you may roll another D1, Luxord deals that much damage to any target.

card.name: KH Marluxia
card.text: Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.) Whenever Marluxia deals combat damage to a creature put a Sentence counter on that creature. (During each upkeep, this creature gets a +0/-1 counter.)

card.name: KH Bloom-out
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase pay {X}, then put a Sentence counter on up to X target creatures. (During each upkeep, creatures with one or more sentence counters get +0/-1)

card.name: KH Larxene
card.text: Double strike, haste Limit break 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with 2 limit break counters. If it has been dealt damage equal to or greater than the number of limit break counters on it, you may add one, then cast a copy of this card’s other face without paying its mana cost.)

card.name: KH Voltic Rush
card.text: During your next turn Larxene has triple strike. (This creature deals first-strike, regular, and last-strike combat damage.) At the beginning of your next precombat main phase create a token that’s a copy of Larxene except it’s a non legendary creature. Exile it at end of turn.

card.name: KH Roxas
card.text: Limit break 2 When Roxas enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Equipment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Roxas gets +1/+1 for each equipment equipped to Roxas past the first one.

card.name: KH Event Horizon
card.text: During your next turn Roxas has first strike, splash damage 1/2 and “Light pillars — When Roxas attacks, create six 1/1 white artifact creature tokens that are tapped and attacking. Exile the tokens at end of combat.”.

card.name: KH Xion
card.text: Limit break 2 When Xion enters the battlefield, target a creature. While that creature is on the field, Xion’s power and toughness are equal to X minus that creature’s power, or 1 if the result would be lower than 1. {1}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. During your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

card.name: KH Vector to the Heavens
card.text: Search your library for a land card mentioned in Vector to the Heavens, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle. You may tap Wonderland. If you do Xion gains flying until end of turn. Create a copy of Sonic Blade. You may cast that copy without paying its mana cost. You may tap Halloween Town. If you do Xion gains reach and trample until end of turn. Create a copy of Ragnarock. You may cast that copy without paying its mana cost. You may tap Agrabah. If you do Xion gains double strike until end of turn. Create a copy of Ars Arcanum. You may cast that copy without paying its mana cost. If you tapped each other land at least once for this effect, you may tap Twilight Town. If you do Xion gains lifelink, splash damage 5 and +3/+3.

card.name: KH The World that Never Was
card.text: The World that Never Was enters the battlefield tapped. W/U/B/R/G, {T}: Add CCC. Partner with The Castle that Never Was. The World that Never Was can be your commander. Flying, Trample

card.name: KH The Castle that Never Was
card.text: Partner with The World that Never Was. The Castle that Never Was can be your commander. I, II, III, IV: Choose one — • Search your library for a Room, add it to your hand, then shuffle. • Put target Room from your graveyard to your hand. V: You may pay CCC. If you do, transform The Castle that Never Was.
card.related: KH The Dragon that Never Was

card.name: KH The Dragon that Never Was
card.text: Flying, trample Boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon that Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. (If a permanent with a shield counter on it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.) When The Dragon that Never Was would be dealt damage, it loses that much toughness instead.
card.related: KH The Castle that Never Was

card.name: KH Naminé
card.text: Limit break 1 When Naminé enters the battlefield, target creature loses all its abilities until Naminé leaves the battlefield. {T}: Create 1 mana of any color.

card.name: KH Naminé, Dead Fantasy
card.text: At the beginning of your next precombat main phase put three +1/+1 counters on Naminé. Naminé gains the following effects if it doesn’t have them: Naminé has reach as long as its power is 2 or greater. Naminé has flying as long as its power is 4 or greater. Naminé has triple strike as long as its power is 6 or greater. Whenever Naminé would take combat damage, you may remove any amount of +1/+1 counters from Naminé. Reduce the combat damage received by that amount.

card.name: KH Sorcerer
card.text: Sorcerer enters the battlefield with a shield counter. (If it would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.) {T}: Put a shield counter on Sorcerer.

card.name: KH Sniper
card.text: Range (When this creature attacks it takes no damage from creatures without range or reach. This creature has reach.)

card.name: KH Dragoon
card.text: Flying Dragoon enters the battlefield with 1 jump counter. {1}, {T}: Dragoon gains one jump counter. {T}: Dragoon phases out. Whenever Dragoon phases in remove all jump counters from it, then it deals that much damage to any target.

card.name: KH Berserker
card.text: Last strike (This creature deals combat damage after creatures without last strike.)

card.name: KH Assassin
card.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

card.name: KH Dancer
card.text: Dancer has +4/+0 and first strike when attacking.

card.name: KH Gambler
card.text: When you cast Gambler, roll a D6. its power and toughness are equal to the result minus one. {1}: Roll a D6. Gambler’s power and toughness become equal to the result minus one.

card.name: KH Reaper
card.text: Whenever Reaper deals damage to a player, that player discards a card if able.

card.name: KH Ninja
card.text: {C}: Ninja gains double strike until end of turn.

card.name: KH Samurai
card.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn’t cause this creature to tap.)

card.name: KH Dusk
card.text: A deck can have up to 13 cards named Dusk.

card.name: KH Twilight Thorn
card.text: Boss, trample, reach (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) 4C, {T}: Ultimate Beam — Deal 8 damage to any target.

card.name: KH Nothing's Call
card.text: You can spend mana as though it was mana of any color to cast Nobody creature spells or activate abilities of Nobody creatures. Flying, trample, boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon That Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. When this creature would be dealt damage, it gains that many +0/-1 counters instead.

card.name: KH Hall of Empty Melodies
card.text: Enchant noncreature permanent. Enchanted card has phasing. When enchanted card leaves the field, you may put Hall of Empty Melodies in your library, then shuffle. Flying, trample, boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon That Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. When this creature would be dealt damage, it gains that many +0/-1 counters instead.

card.name: KH Proof of Existence
card.text: 2C, {T}: Return target Legendary Nobody creature from your graveyard to your hand. Flying, trample, boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon That Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. When this creature would be dealt damage, it gains that many +0/-1 counters instead.

card.name: KH Altar of Naught
card.text: CC, {T}: Remove 1 limit counter from target creature. CC, {T}: Deal 1 damage to target creature. {T}: Add {C}. Flying, trample, boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon That Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. When this creature would be dealt damage, it gains that many +0/-1 counters instead.

card.name: KH Where Nothing Gathers
card.text: {T}: Add CC. Flying, trample, boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon That Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. When this creature would be dealt damage, it gains that many +0/-1 counters instead.

card.name: KH Betwixt and Between
card.text: Search your library for a creature with mana value X or less, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on the battlefield. Flying, trample, boss (You cannot cast this creature spell if you already control a creature with Boss.) The Dragon That Never Was enters the battlefield with 2 shield counters on it. When this creature would be dealt damage, it gains that many +0/-1 counters instead.
